alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 10 at 9:35AM MST until September 10 at 12:30PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Coconino County in north central Arizona... * Until 1230 PM MST. * At 933 AM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 0.75 and 1.25 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the side canyons and tributaries adjacent to the Colorado River. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Hermit`s Rest At Grand Canyon, Pima Point At Grand Canyon, Grand Canyon National Park and Havasupai Reservation. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Shinumo Creek, Flint Creek, Phantom Creek, Salt Creek, Hundred and Twenty Mile Creek, Hundred and Twentyeight Mile Creek, Hermit Creek, Colorado River, Havasu Creek, Dragon Creek, Crystal Creek, Milk Creek, Bright Angel Creek, Tuna Creek, Prairie Wash, Royal Arch Creek, Hundred and Twentyseven Mile Creek, Trinity Creek, Boucher Creek, Ninetyone Mile Creek, Pasture Wash, Coconino Wash, Heather Wash and Monument Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Normally dry washes, slot canyons and creeks can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
